post_title: #17. The Pete Dye Course at French Lick Resort
tooltip_content: #17. The Pete Dye Course at French Lick Resort

post_content:
We officially kicked off the Ultimate Golf Road Trip a few days ago, and already we've veered off course for some spontaneous rounds of golf. Driving right past our intended initial destination of Jacksonville, Florida, we continued trucking down I-95 toward Jupiter. Watch our first video for this epic trip below! In lieu of traditional blog posts, we'll be sharing a lot of video "Episodes" throughout the trip.

So why did we keep heading south? Well, when a fellow golf enthusiasts hears about your cross country golf road trip, introduces himself, and invites you to his home club to get a few warm-up rounds in, you don't turn him down. The course lineup in Jupiter was a round at The Dye Preserve, a private track that many tour pros call home, followed by the best par 3 executive course I've ever stepped foot on, the Palm Beach Par 3. [caption id="attachment_2579" align="aligncenter" width="650"] The Dye Preserve[/caption] [caption id="attachment_2578" align="aligncenter" width="650"] Palm Beach Par 3[/caption] We hit it off with our host Rob, who also has a bit of a story when it comes to the best golf courses in America (I'll let you watch the video for dets!) After a few fantastic days, we're currently headed back north to kick-off the "official" first round on another Pete Dye gem, this one sitting in the top 10 of Golf Digest's ranked America's 100 Greatest Public Courses. Any guesses where we're playing first? Be sure follow all the action from this year's Ultimate Golf Road Trip by joining us here!
post_title: Bonus Rounds in Jupiter: The Dye Preserve & Palm Beach Par 3
tooltip_content:
Bonus Rounds in Jupiter: The Dye Preserve & Palm Beach Par 3
After kicking off the Ultimate Golf Road Trip, we couldn't help but veer off course before we even played our first Golf Digest ranked public course. Driving right past our intended initial destination of Jacksonville, Florida, we continued trucking down I-95 to Jupiter. And what a blast we had! Watch our first rounds of 2017 here.

post_title: #37. May River Golf Club at Palmetto Bluff
tooltip_content: #37. May River Golf Club at Palmetto Bluff

#10. TPC Sawgrass (Stadium)
As I stood behind the famed 17th island green at TPC Sawgrass, gave my camera a rest and watched in awe as the sun crested over the horizon on this iconic hole, I couldn't help but become overtaken with emotion. "I can't believe I'm here right now," I muttered to myself in disbelief. Watch the full-video of our TPC Sawgrass experience!

#97. Bay Hill Club (Champion/Challenger)
As you walk the lush fairways at Bay Hill, you can't help but believe Arnie's looking down on you from above. Watch Episode 3 for an inside look at Arnold Palmer's home course: Bay Hill Club. // Golf Digest Rank: #97

#91. Dancing Rabbit Golf Club
Dancing Rabbit marked our 9th round on the Ultimate Golf Road Trip. Tight fairways demanding shot shaping off the tees characterized this course. // Golf Digest ranking: 91st

#66. World Woods Golf Club (Pine Barrens)
Tucked in the western part of Florida you'll find the tree-lined fairways of World Woods Golf Club. We teed it up at the Pine Barrens course, which is one of the best values you'll find on the top 100 public course list. // Golf Digest rank: 66th

#18 & #24. Streamsong (Red & Blue)
It takes little time to realize this is a unique place. Larger-than-life fescue covered dunes, massive bunkers and a natural feeling landscape that coaxes you into believe this place has been around forever. Welcome to Streamsong.

#36. Fallen Oak Golf Club
In the heart of the De Soto National Forest, a mere 20 minutes from Biloxi, Mississippi you'll find Fallen Oak. Guest's of MGM Resorts Beau Rivage Resort & Casino can enjoy a round on this fantastic Fazio design. // Golf Digest rank: 36

#50. The Dunes Golf & Beach Club
We all know Myrtle Beach has plenty of golf courses, but quantity doesn't always translate to quality. The Dunes Golf & Beach Club is certainly the latter though, with a beautiful and challenging layout near the ocean. // Golf Digest Ranking: 50th

#38. Old Waverly Golf Club
Our 10th round on the Ultimate Golf Road Trip took us to Old Waverly, one of the most charming golf properties around. A friendly front nine gives way to a challenging, yet beautiful inward nine - 5 holes of which snake along a large lake.

post_title: #83. The Donald Ross Course at French Lick Resort
tooltip_content: #83. The Donald Ross Course at French Lick Resort

#56. Golf Club at Cuscowilla
The Golf Club at Cuscowilla is another example of a fun Coore & Crenshaw design. Lakeside holes, drivable par 4's, and unique red-colored bunkers make for a great golf experience. The only downside? In 2015 the course actually went from public (for resort guests) to private.

#73. Caledonia Golf & Fish Club
Just a short drive from the golf haven of Myrtle Beach, Caledonia offers another Mike Strantz masterpiece. Tree-lined fairways challenge your game while providing beauty along the way. Also, take a look at sister course True Blue, another Strantz design that's just across the street and well worth a play.

#71. Tobacco Road Golf Club
Tobacco Road Golf Club is hands down the most unique golf course we've ever played. Interesting sight lines, an intriguing layout, and never a dull hole. Tobacco Road is a must play in the Pinehurst area, if not for it's uniqueness, then for it's pure enjoyment. // Golf Digest Ranking: 71

#5, #59, #80. Pinehurst Resort (Course No. 2, 4 & 8)
Tucked in the sandhills of North Carolina, you'll find the home of American Golf: Pinehurst Resort. It's one of the most special places we've visited, boasting a history filled clubhouse and nine golf courses. Take a look at three of the best on the property: Course No. 2, 4 & 8

post_title: #69. Omni Barton Creek Resort & Spa (Fazio Canyons)
tooltip_content:
#69. Omni Barton Creek Resort & Spa (Fazio Canyons)
A classic Texas hill country golf experience, Barton Creek's Fazio Canyons Course provides some dramatic elevation changes and stellar views. // Golf Digest rank: 69

#43. Dormie Club
Dormie Club is one of the most secluded, natural golf courses you'll find. Uninterrupted by houses or roadways, Dormie offers a fun round of golf on a scenic layout. // Golf Digest Ranking: 43

#3. The Ocean Course
The Ocean Course on Kiawah Island is one of the most magnificent courses you'll ever play. It's America's version of links golf, with no shortage of wind, fescue, and beautiful ocean-side golf holes. // Golf Digest Rank: 3rd

#68. TPC San Antonio (AT&T Oaks)
As host to the PGA Tour each year, TPC San Antonio's AT&T Oaks course certainly packs a punch. // Golf Digest rank: 68

post_title: #95. Great Waters Course at Reynolds Plantation
tooltip_content:
#95. Great Waters Course at Reynolds Plantation
With the Azaleas in bloom, and Lake Oconee acting as the backdrop on many of the holes, the Great Waters Course is a beautiful golf experience. Add in the fact there are 5 other courses at Reynolds Lake Oconee, and this may very well serve as your next golf destination.

#64. Pine Needles Lodge & Golf Club
Pinehurst has no shortage of classic style golf courses, and Pine Needles is among the best. The restored Donald Ross layout will challenge you with tree-lined fairways and tough crowned greens. Also, be sure to play "The Loop," a 4-hole short course on property, and Mid Pines, another Ross sister course across the street. // Golf Digest Ranking: 64

#19. Harbour Town Golf Links
It's hard to describe the special feeling at Harbour Town, but one thing's for sure -- this bucket list destination needs to be on the top of your golf travel list! // Golf Digest ranking: 19
